more light on a solar cell you not only get more power but you can potentially get a higher efficiency however there is an important limit at some point the internal serial resistance of the cell come in to play if there is too much resistance the new current you are generating cannot all be extracted from the solar cell and efficiency drop off in fact all solar cell have a characteristic curve of efficiency versus concentration ratio and an optimum concentration ratio at which that efficiency is maximized that might look like this httpwwwintechopencomsourcehtml32594mediaimage1jpg silicon solar cell used in flat plate are designed for use under normal sunlight what we call 1 sun so they are relatively large and have a relatively large internal series resistance so they really cant be used efficiently at more than a few sun of concentration beyond that youll get to the point where there iv curve look like a diagonal line largish silicon cell can be designed for concentration ratio in this is fine since iiiv cell can be stacked a multijunction cell with 4045 efficiency and in economic term the complication of concentration and the need to then track your solar panel to the sun is only sensible when high efficiency cell are used and of course the thermal effect ubreintje mention are important a well although in practice this mean that you pay more for heat sink and the like the purpose of arch in the human foot is to absorb shock and distribute weight evenly across the foot

for multiple reason im assuming you are flat footed and experience knee pain like most young adult in the west its multifaceted our foot are designed a a second class lever so instead of being digitigrade toe bone make the foot we are plantigrade the foot make a base with the heel this provides greater vertical weight support is more energy efficient than bending your knee all day thanks to your heal and provides lateral leverage for turning and strafing thats the foot why the arch the arch creates supination which act a a spring across the posterior tibialis and the medial inner muscle of the calf this is because we are bipedal upright primate quadrupeds use their ab to rotate their frontal plane which for them is head to toe but for humans it back to front transversely our ab cant rotate u well so we use our glute abductor and arch to turn in this plane regarding our leg our 5th toe also help u strafe by dragging our leg in that direction when abducting our leg when the foot is pronated ignoring the arch our foot are like most blade design meant to drag the ground behind u efficiently to move u forward scientists say that humans evolved too quickly and the foot is a slap dash evolution for bipedalism from our former more handlike appendage although true it work fine when fully developed in the west thanks to our sedentary lifestyle overuse of shoe lack of strength training and lifestyle factor like being obese the ligament of the foot become stretched or cramped and no longer form an ideal structure our foot were a quick fix for bipedalism so our ligament dont adapt for these factor compare u to ostriches and other bipedal bird who have evolved their foot for million more year than humans all their weight bares on their 1st toe rather than the ball of their feetheel and their 2nd toe replaces the need to supinate digitigrade foot are more dexterous than human foot which decrease the margin of error in development considering all this this is why humans experience foot issue and in reflection id say the human achieves many feat despite all of it compromise it doe the best with what it ha and doe
